keyPolicies.policyDescription: Jo Johnson expresses concern about anti-social behaviour and suggests that policing levels are not adequate, as per a survey showing that 91% are concerned about anti-social behaviour.

The leaflet pledges to increase spending on the NHS every year to ensure the money is well-spent, focusing on reducing management layers in the NHS in England and increasing the number of qualified nurses.

mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Mayor Boris, The Bromley Borough, John Horam

issues.health: Concern is rising over threats to the NHS. There is overwhelming demand for a full public consultation over the future of Orpington Hospital. Satisfaction with the NHS is high but concern is rising.

leaflet.personalStatement: I have had a staggering response to the questionnaire that I sent out last month to all households in the constituency. More than 3,000 households provided responses and these have overwhelmingly confirmed my priorities for Orpington.

images.caption: Jo Johnson with Kit Malthouse, Chairman of the Metropolitan Police Authority at Orpington College talking to students.
